abstract: Researchers at University of Oxford report in journal The Lancet that radiation treatment after surgery for breast cancer significantly lowers risk that disease will recur or spread lethally over following 10 to 15 years.
snippet: Radiation lowered the risk of recurrence over the following 10 to 15 years, researchers said.
lead_paragraph: Radiation lowered the risk of recurrence over the following 10 to 15 years, researchers said.

headline.main: Benefit in Radiation After Breast Cancer Surgery
headline.print_headline: Radiation Therapy After Breast Cancer Surgery Cuts Recurrence, Study Says
headline.seo: Study Finds Benefit to Radiation After Breast Cancer Surgery
